intro: Galium canum var. confertum, commonly known as clustered woodypod, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several minute seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
